intro: Tium racemosum, commonly known as the racemose tium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Tium racemosum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
